text:
Here are the steps I used to install the CVS version of Xindice (Xindice
1.1) this morning. I hope this is useful to those who - like me - couldn't
find any documentation on this.

1. Login to Apache public CVS:

cvs -d :pserver:anoncvs@cvs.apache.org:/home/cvspublic login
password: anoncvs

2. Checkout Xindice from CVS

cvs -d :pserver:anoncvs@cvs.apache.org:/home/cvspublic checkout xml-xindice

3. Change to the xml-xindice directory which you've just checked out

cd xml-xindice/

4. Build Xindice with ant

ant/bin

5. Build the Xindice.war file

ant/bin war

6. Install TomCat if you haven't already

http://jakarta.apache.org/tomcat/ (I'm using 4.1.1)

7. Copy Xindice.war into Tomcat's webapps directory

cp Xindice.war [Tomcat home]/webapps/

8. Restart Tomcat

9. Test your installation by adding a new Xindice collection

bin/xindice ac -c /db -n test

10. Add a document to the collection

bin/xindice ad -c /db/test -f test.xml -n test

11. And query it

bin/xindice xpath -c /db/test -q "//page_title[@id='99:1']"

addendum

to modify the location of the Xindice database, update the dbroot attribute of
the root-collection element found in the system.xml located in the WEB-INF folder.
